atan.model

Class CommandFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • atan.model.CommandFactory

  • public class CommandFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates an easy interface between Java and the SServer. By calling the methods in this class, it creates String's that the SServer can understand.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandFactory()
      Constructs a blank command factory.

    • Method Detail

      • addPlayerInitCommand

        public void addPlayerInitCommand(java.lang.String teamName,
                        boolean isGoalie,
                        java.lang.String version)
        This is used to initialise a player.
        Parameters:
        teamName - The team the player belongs to.
        isGoalie - If the player is a goalie. Note: Only one goalie per team.
        version -

      • addTrainerInitCommand

        public void addTrainerInitCommand(java.lang.String version)
        This is used to initialise a trainer.
        Parameters:
        version - The version of the server expected.

      • addCoachInitCommand

        public void addCoachInitCommand(java.lang.String teamName,
                       java.lang.String version)
        This is used to initialise the online coach.
        Parameters:
        teamName - The team the coach belongs to.
        version - The version of the server expected.

      • addReconnectCommand

        public void addReconnectCommand(java.lang.String teamName,
                       int num)
        This is used to reconnect the player to the server.
        Parameters:
        teamName -
        num -

      • addCatchCommand

        public void addCatchCommand(int direction)
        Goalie special command. Tries to catch the ball in a given direction relative to its body direction. If the catch is successful the ball will be in the goalies hand untill kicked away.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in which to catch, relative to its body.

      • addChangeViewCommand

        public void addChangeViewCommand(ViewAngle angle,
                        ViewQuality quality)
        Changes the view parameters of the player. The amount and detail returned by the visual sensor depends on the width of view and the quality. But note that the frequency of sending information also depends on these parameters. (eg. If you change the quality from high to low, the frequency doubles, and the time between the two see sensors will be cut in half).
        Parameters:
        angle - Between narrow, normal or wide.
        quality - Between high or low.

      • addDashCommand

        public void addDashCommand(int power)
        This command accelerates the player in the direction of its body.
        Parameters:
        power - Power is between minpower (-100) and maxpower (+100).

      • addKickCommand

        public void addKickCommand(int power,
                  int direction)
        This command accelerates the ball with the given power in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        power - Power is between minpower (-100) and maxpower (+100).
        direction - Direction is relative to the body of the player.

      • addMoveCommand

        public void addMoveCommand(int x,
                  int y)
        This command can only be executed before kick off or after a goal.
        Parameters:
        x - X location (between -54 and +54).
        y - Y location (between -32 and +32).

      • addTurnCommand

        public void addTurnCommand(int angle)
        This command will turn the players body in degrees relative to their current direction.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle to turn (between -180 and +180).

      • addTurnNeckCommand

        public void addTurnNeckCommand(int angle)
        This command can be sent (and will be executed) each cycle independently, along with other action commands. The neck will rotate witht he given angle relative to the previous angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle to turn the neck (between minneckang and maxneckang) (-90 to +90)

      • addSayCommand

        public void addSayCommand(java.lang.String message)
        This command broadcasts the message throughout the field. Any player near enough (specified with audio_cut_dist default 50.0 neters), with enough hearing capacity will hear the message.
        Parameters:
        message - A valid String to say.

      • addSenseBodyCommand

        public void addSenseBodyCommand()
        Requests the server to send sense body information. Note: SServer version 6 and above sends this with every cycle.

      • addChangePlayModeCommand

        public void addChangePlayModeCommand(PlayMode playMode)
        Trainer only command. Changes the play mode of the server.
        Parameters:
        playMode -

      • addMovePlayerCommand

        public void addMovePlayerCommand(ActionsPlayer p,
                        double x,
                        double y)
        Trainer only command. Moves the given player to the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        p -
        x -
        y -

      • addMoveBallCommand

        public void addMoveBallCommand(double x,
                      double y)
        Trainer only command. Moves the ball to the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • addCheckBallCommand

        public void addCheckBallCommand()
        Trainer only command. Checks the current status of the ball.

      • addStartCommand

        public void addStartCommand()
        Trainer only command. Starts the server.

      • addRecoverCommand

        public void addRecoverCommand()
        Trainer only command. Recovers the players stamina, recovery, effort and hear capacity to the values at the beginning of the game.

      • addEarCommand

        public void addEarCommand()
        Trainer only command. It turns on or off the sending of auditory information to the trainer.

      • addEyeCommand

        public void addEyeCommand()
        Trainer command that can be used by online coach. It turns on or off the sending of "(see_global ...)" information from the server.

      • addLookCommand

        public void addLookCommand()
        Trainer command that can be used by online coach. This command provides information about the positions of the following objects on the field. The left and right goals? (Do they move?) The ball. All active players.

      • addTeamNamesCommand

        public void addTeamNamesCommand()
        Trainer command that can be used by online coach. This command provedes information about the names of both teams and which side they are playing on.

      • addByeCommand

        public void addByeCommand()
        This is used to disconnect a player/coach/trainer from the server. The server will not respond.

        public java.lang.String next()
        Returns:
